Dataframe outputs

Indrajeet Patil

2020-10-27

Source: vignettes/dataframe_outputs.Rmd
dataframe_outputs.Rmd

Introduction

Although the primary focus of this package is to get expressions containing statistical results, one can also use it to extract dataframes containing these details. This vignette catalogs dataframe outputs from all functions.

A dataframe will typically contain the following columns:

  • estimate: estimated value of the posterior.

  • conf.low: lower bound for posterior estimate.

  • conf.high: upper bound for posterior estimate.

In addition to some other relevant columns that will depend on the test.

One-sample tests

# setup
library(tidyBF)

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
bf_ttest(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  bf.prior = 0.8,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term       estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference  0.00952   -0.250     0.255 0.532           0.619
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component    bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>       <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0         0.8 fixed  conditional 0.130
#>   log_e_bf10
#>        <dbl>
#> 1      -2.04

Two-sample tests

within-subjects design

# setup
library(tidyBF)

# data
df <- dplyr::filter(bugs_long, condition %in% c("LDLF", "LDHF"))

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
bf_ttest(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term       estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference    -1.62    -2.12     -1.14     1               0
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component       bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>          <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0       0.707 fixed  conditional 4762370.
#>   log_e_bf10
#>        <dbl>
#> 1       15.4

between-subjects design

# setup
library(tidyBF)

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
bf_ttest(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term       estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference    -3.16    -6.66     0.528 0.960          0.0424
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component    bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>       <dbl>
#> 1 cauchy                          0       0.707 fixed  conditional  1.20
#>   log_e_bf10
#>        <dbl>
#> 1      0.181

One-way ANOVAs

within-subjects design

if (utils::packageVersion("BayesFactor") >= package_version("0.9.12-4.3")) {
  # for reproducibility
  set.seed(123)
  bf_oneway_anova(
    data = bugs_long,
    x = condition,
    y = desire,
    paired = TRUE,
    subject.id = subject,
    output = "dataframe"
  )
}
#> # A tibble: 96 x 19
#>    term           estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>    <chr>             <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#>  1 mu                6.88     6.43      7.33  1              0     
#>  2 condition-HDHF    0.912    0.554     1.24  1              0

between-subjects design

# setup
library(tidyBF)

set.seed(123)
bf_oneway_anova(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 18
#>   term               estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>                 <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 mu                   5.84     5.76       5.93  1               0    
#> 2 Species-setosa      -0.829   -0.947     -0.713 1               0    
#> 3 Species-versicolor   0.0916  -0.0275     0.208 0.936           0.434
#> 4 Species-virginica    0.737    0.618      0.852 1               0    
#> 5 sig2                 0.267    0.210      0.335 1               0    
#> 6 g_Species            2.15     0.188     15.0   1               0    
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale effect component      bf10
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>         <dbl>
#> 1 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  extra       1.87e28
#> 2 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  conditional 1.87e28
#> 3 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  conditional 1.87e28
#> 4 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  conditional 1.87e28
#> 5 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  extra       1.87e28
#> 6 <NA>                           NA          NA fixed  extra       1.87e28
#>   log_e_bf10    r2 std.dev ci.width r2.conf.low r2.conf.high

#> 6       65.1 0.612  0.0310       95       0.544        0.667

Contingency table analyses

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(tidyBF)

# ------------------------ association tests -----------------------------

# unpaired
set.seed(123)
bf_contingency_tab(
  data = mtcars,
  x = am,
  y = cyl,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>    bf10 log_e_bf10 term      estimate ci.width conf.low conf.high    pd rope.ci
#>   <dbl>      <dbl> <chr>        <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1  16.8       2.82 Cramers_v    0.476       95    0.207     0.701     1      89
#>   rope.low rope.high rope.percentage prior.scale
#>      <dbl>     <dbl>           <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1     -0.1       0.1               0           1

# ------------------------ goodness of fit tests ---------------------------

# with counts
set.seed(123)
bf_contingency_tab(
  data = as.data.frame(HairEyeColor),
  x = Eye,
  counts = Freq,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>      bf10 log_e_bf10 prior.scale
#>     <dbl>      <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 1.72e26       60.4           1

Correlation analyses

# setup
library(tidyBF)

set.seed(123)
bf_corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  output = "dataframe"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   term  estimate conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage prior.distribution
#>   <chr>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl> <chr>             
#> 1 rho     -0.843   -0.934    -0.734     1               0 cauchy            
#>   prior.location prior.scale effect component        bf10 log_e_bf10
#>            <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>  <chr>           <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1              0       0.707 fixed  conditional 56223033.       17.8

Meta-analysis

# setup
set.seed(123)
library(tidyBF)

# creating a dataframe
df <-
  structure(
    .Data = list(
      study = c("1", "2", "3", "4", "5"),
      estimate = c(
        0.382047603321706,
        0.780783111514665,
        0.425607573765058,
        0.558365541235078,
        0.956473848429961
      ),
      std.error = c(
        0.0465576338644502,
        0.0330218199731529,
        0.0362834986178494,
        0.0480571500648261,
        0.062215818388157
      )
    ),
    row.names = c(NA, -5L),
    class = c("tbl_df", "tbl", "data.frame")
  )

set.seed(123)
bf_meta_random(data = df, output = "dataframe")
#> # A tibble: 2 x 12
#>   term    estimate std.error conf.low conf.high weight  bf10  rhat   ess
#>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 Overall    0.517     0.137    0.221     0.749     NA  28.2  1.00 1427.
#> 2 tau        0.289     0.132    0.119     0.558     NA  NA    1.00 1496.
#>   component log_e_bf10 prior.scale
#>   <chr>          <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 meta            3.34       0.707
#> 2 meta           NA          0.707
